``` feat: Implement consistent Keycloak theme with Shadcn UI
This commit introduces a comprehensive re-theming of Keycloak login and registration pages using Shadcn UI components and Tailwind CSS, aligning with a provided design inspiration.
Key changes include:
- **Centralized Template (`Template.tsx`):** - Implemented a universal, responsive card-based layout with a frosted glass effect for all Keycloak pages. - Integrated dynamic header rendering based on the specific form. - Added a global background image. - Ensured basic dark mode compatibility for core elements and messages. - Placed the brand logo consistently at the top of the form card.
- **Refactored Pages for Consistency:** - **`Login.tsx`:** Updated input fields with icons and placeholders, restyled the login button ("Get Started"), and adjusted social provider layout to match the inspiration. - **`Error.tsx`:** Styled error messages and transformed the "Back to Application" link into a primary button. - **`LoginOauthGrant.tsx`:** Enhanced styling for consent request details and action buttons. - **`LoginPassword.tsx`:** Applied consistent input field styling with icons and updated button appearance. - **`LoginResetPassword.tsx`:** Standardized input field styling, converted the "Back to Login" link into a secondary button. - **`LoginUpdatePassword.tsx`:** Applied consistent styling for new and confirm password fields, and updated button styles. - **`LoginUpdateProfile.tsx`:** Ensured the profile update form adheres to the new design, including button styling. - **`LoginUsername.tsx`:** Standardized username/email input with icons and styling for the remember me checkbox. - **`LoginVerifyEmail.tsx`:** Updated instructional text styling and the "Click Here" link. - **`Register.tsx`:** Applied consistent input styling for user profile fields, re-styled social providers, and updated terms acceptance checkbox. - **`LoginIdpLinkConfirm.tsx`:** Styled the confirmation message and action buttons for IDP linking. - **`LoginIdpLinkEmail.tsx`:** Styled the email linking instructions, username input, and action buttons.
- **Improved UX/UI:** - Standardized font sizes, boldness, and alignment for headers and text. - Ensured interactive elements (buttons, links) are clearly styled and responsive. - Addressed various TypeScript and ESLint warnings to improve code quality.
This extensive refactoring provides a modern, cohesive, and user-friendly experience across all Keycloak authentication flows. ```
